geologicalAndEcologicalFeatures.coralReefs: One of the world’s longest continuous living coral reefs
endemicSpecies: 90% of fishes are Red Sea dottybacks and triple fins fish

historyAndHumanImpact.earlyExploration: By ancient Egyptians around 2,500 BC and 1500 BC
historyAndHumanImpact.historicalTradeRoutes: Favored by Romans for trade with India
modernDevelopments: Used for spice trade during the Middle Ages

conservationEfforts: PERSGA initiative for coordinated management actions

tectonicActivity.RedSeaRift: Part of the Great Rift Valley
tectonicActivity.seafloorSpreading: Occurs at a rate of 1-2 centimeters per year
